title: So That, For, To | Expressing Purpose

questions.question: I talked to the shy girl ................................ that she would not feel left out.
questions.description: We use the pattern so that to express the purpose here.

questions.question: We stopped at the restaurant .............................. lunch.
questions.description: Before a noun 'for' indicates the purpose in doing something.

questions.question: We stopped at the restaurant .................................... lunch.
questions.description: For cannot be used before a verb in this sense.

questions.question: I went to America ................................. my brother.
A barometer is used ................................. pressure.
questions.description: For + ing can be used to express the purpose of a thing when that thing is the subject of the clause.

questions.question: I warned him ................................... he would not repeat the same mistake.
questions.description: Before a clause we use so that.

questions.question: We eat .................................. we may live.
questions.description: We use so that before a clause to express purpose.

questions.question: We started early ................................... we would not be late.
We bought some burgers ................................ eat on the way.
He was sent to prison ................................... stealing.
questions.description: For + ing form can be used to explain the behaviour that caused the reaction mentioned in the previous part of the sentence.
